alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Campbell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued July 16 at 12:30AM EDT until July 16 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE POTENTIAL FAILURE OF COLLEGE LAKE DAM ON THE BLACKWATER CREEK IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flash Flooding caused by a potential dam or levee failure is possible at the College Lake Dam. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties, Amherst and Campbell. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Dam failure may result in flash flooding of low-lying areas below the dam. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Significant runoff may cause flooding of creeks and rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain from thunderstorms has dropped between 2 and 4 inches of rainfall tonight, causing the levels of College Lake to rise. Additional rainfall of up to 1 inch is possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. Dam safety experts with state and local emergency services are monitoring the dam and will issue a public statement as conditions warrant. PLAN NOW so you will know what to do in an emergency. Keep informed by listening to local radio and television for statements and possible warnings. Follow the advice of public safety officials.
